intro: Voacanga globosa, commonly known as the African apple or wild mango, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, yellowish-orange, fleshy fruits. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. The fruit contains a single large, hard seed surrounded by a fleshy, aromatic pulp.
